intro: Odontostemma zhongdianense, commonly known as the Zhongdian stonecrop, is a unique succulent plant native to the high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink, often blooming in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
